message:
First of all, thanks for your awesome blogs!

I have a quick question:
I have a sync method from which I need to call HttpClient async method e.g. SendAsync.  I can't change the framework  (which is mainly a background item processor).

Now, what are my options to call async method.  I see below options:
1) Task.Run - Wouldn't this option result in spawning a new task for every operation?  I am concerned about wasting resources by creating new task/thread every time.
2) ConfigureAWait all the way - I see mixed reviews of this one.. 

The options are outlined in blog below:
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/pfxteam/2012/03/24/should-i-expose-asynchronous-wrappers-for-synchronous-methods/

I would like to learn what's the best practice for such cases as this seems a very common case..
